Controls the server's tick rate during the Time Warp sequence. Lower values (e.g., 50) ensure high stability and smooth sky movement. Higher values (e.g., 100+) increase simulation speed but may cause server lag. Recommended: 50.
gamerule.minecraft.truesleep_virtual_tps: Target Game Speed. Determines how many game ticks pass for every real-world second during sleep. A value of 1000 means 1 second of real time = 1000 ticks (~50s) of game time. Controls how fast the night passes.
gamerule.minecraft.truesleep_sleep_thres: The precise time of day (in ticks) when players are allowed to start sleeping. Vanilla default is dusk (~12542). Lowering this allows sleeping earlier in the day.
gamerule.minecraft.truesleep_wake_time.d: The target time of day (in ticks) that the Time Warp aims to reach before waking the player. Default is 0 (Dawn). Adjusting this changes when the 'night' effectively ends.
gamerule.minecraft.truesleep_drown_immun: Safety Protocol: If enabled, grants temporary water-breathing to all entities during the Time Warp. Prevents players and mobs from drowning due to the accelerated passage of time while swimming.
